name: Jogo Programming Language
body:
## Introduction

Jogo is a high(er) performance compiled language (like C++) with a clean, powerful syntax (like Python, Lua, or Ruby).  It is designed for programming games and game servers.

## Documentation
* [Quick Tour](https://github.com/mfichman/jogo/wiki/Quick-Tour-of-the-Jogo-Programming-Language)
* [Tutorial](https://github.com/mfichman/jogo/wiki)
* [Download and Installation](https://github.com/mfichman/jogo/wiki/Download-and-Installation)
* [Standard Library Reference](https://github.com/mfichman/jogo/wiki/Standard-Library-Reference)
* [Compiler and Tools Manual](https://github.com/mfichman/jogo/wiki/Compiler-and-Tools-Manual)
* [Jogo FAQ](https://github.com/mfichman/jogo/wiki/Jogo-FAQ)

## Downloads

* Debian: [jogo-0.3.0.deb](https://jogo-downloads.s3.amazonaws.com/jogo-0.3.0.deb)
* OS X: [jogo-0.3.0.pkg](https://jogo-downloads.s3.amazonaws.com/jogo-0.3.0.pkg)
* Windows: [jogo-0.3.0.exe](https://jogo-downloads.s3.amazonaws.com/jogo-0.3.0.exe)

## Who started this thing?

Jogo was designed and written by [Matt Fichman](https://github.com/mfichman).

## How can I contribute?

I'm looking for help with Jogo.  Starting a new language is a big task.  In particular, I need help writing lots of additional tests, libraries, and compiler back-ends (x86-32 and ARM in particular -- the compiler currently only outputs x86-64).  If you'd like to contribute, check out the [GitHub repository](https://github.com/mfichman/jogo), add yourself to the [contributors page](https://github.com/mfichman/jogo/wiki/Contributors) and send me a pull request.  Also, check out the [wish list](https://github.com/mfichman/jogo/issues?labels=wishlist&page=1&state=open).
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
